update.description:
Latest anaconda breaks our installer by removing the CONDA_PYTHON_EXE environment variable.

This PR modifies our installer to use CONDA_EXE instead. This variable exists in previous anacondas too, so is backward compatible back to at least version 4.4, which the installer checks the currently running version is at least as high as.

Rejig the version check to call conda and ask for the version rather than assuming it based on environment variables.

We previously used CONDA_PYTHON_EXE to determine the location of pythonw.exe
and cwp.py. But it was removed in conda 4.6.11. Now we find pythonw.exe and
cwp.py as relative paths to CONDA_EXE, which points to a known path in
the root environment.

Assumptions are made in either case about where things are located within the
anaconda directory, but this cannot be helped since there is no way to know
where these scripts and executables are in any canonical way at the moment.
update.title: In conda 4.6.11, CONDA_PYTHON_EXE does not exist. Modify to use CONDA_EXE instead.

content.raw: You also _use_ `version` in the string of the error message. This is what will break I think.
content.html: You also use version in the string of the error message. This is what will break I think.

pull_request.title: In conda 4.6.11, CONDA_PYTHON_EXE does not exist. Modify to use CONDA_EXE instead.

pullrequest.title: In conda 4.6.11, CONDA_PYTHON_EXE does not exist. Modify to use CONDA_EXE instead.

content.raw:
If `conda_exe` is None there isn't an issue because Python doesn't evaluate the second argument to an `or` if the first one is True.

Second issue, yeah, those people will have lots of issues. Qt and numpy and stuff might break with DLL errors. I’m just going to check what the latest anaconda installer says about adding things to your PATH, and whether the ‘add anaconda to my path' setting, if it’s even there still, sets all conda environment variables or just PATH, since if it’s the former those people will be fine.

Nonetheless I’ll modify the installation instructions to be more explicit about all this.

‌
content.html:
If conda_exe is None there isn't an issue because Python doesn't evaluate the second argument to an or if the first one is True.

Second issue, yeah, those people will have lots of issues. Qt and numpy and stuff might break with DLL errors. I’m just going to check what the latest anaconda installer says about adding things to your PATH, and whether the ‘add anaconda to my path' setting, if it’s even there still, sets all conda environment variables or just PATH, since if it’s the former those people will be fine.

Nonetheless I’ll modify the installation instructions to be more explicit about all this.

‌

pull_request.title: In conda 4.6.11, CONDA_PYTHON_EXE does not exist. Modify to use CONDA_EXE instead.

pullrequest.title: In conda 4.6.11, CONDA_PYTHON_EXE does not exist. Modify to use CONDA_EXE instead.

content.raw:
So I think it would be good to merge this quickly so that new installers \(aka possibly my thesis examiners\) can make it work!

Issues I can see:

* If `conda_exe` is `None`, then the error message the installer prints will break because `version` is not defined.
* There are probably issues with people manually adding anaconda Python to their PATH on windows, but I think these are bigger than this fix, so probably not worth trying to handle here \(maybe we just need an extra line in the installation instructions for Windows users telling people to use “anaconda prompt” rather than the Windows terminal\)
content.html:
So I think it would be good to merge this quickly so that new installers (aka possibly my thesis examiners) can make it work!

Issues I can see:

  • If conda_exe is None, then the error message the installer prints will break because version is not defined.
  • There are probably issues with people manually adding anaconda Python to their PATH on windows, but I think these are bigger than this fix, so probably not worth trying to handle here (maybe we just need an extra line in the installation instructions for Windows users telling people to use “anaconda prompt” rather than the Windows terminal)

pull_request.title: In conda 4.6.11, CONDA_PYTHON_EXE does not exist. Modify to use CONDA_EXE instead.
